name: Calendula
climate: Calendula thrives in temperate climates with mild temperatures.
This plant can tolerate some light frost but not extreme cold.
Calendula grows well in regions with moderate humidity levels.
Excessive heat and humidity can cause the plant to become stressed.
sunlight: Calendula requires full sun to bloom abundantly and stay healthy.
It can tolerate partial shade, but flowering might be reduced.
Ensure the plant receives at least six hours of sunlight daily.
Too much shade can lead to leggy growth and fewer blooms.
watering: Water calendula regularly but allow the soil to dry between waterings.
Overwatering can lead to root rot, so adequate drainage is essential.
During hot weather, increase watering frequency to maintain soil moisture.
Reduce watering during cooler months when plant growth slows down.
soil: Calendula prefers well-draining soil with good organic matter content.
A slightly acidic to neutral pH range is ideal for calendula growth.
Add compost or aged manure to enrich sandy or poor-quality soils.
Heavy clay soils should be amended for better drainage and aeration.
extra_care_tip: Deadhead spent blooms regularly to encourage continuous flowering.
Apply a balanced fertilizer during the growing season for optimal health.
